news politics family-friends-to-allowed-hug-"" %, rgba, rgba, url"Get our daily coronavirus email newsletter with all the news you need to know direct to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.When you subscribe we will use the information you provide to send you these newsletters. Your information will be used in accordance with ourPrivacy Notice.Thank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee ourprivacy noticeFamily and friends will be allowed from next week as long as people use their common sense, it has been revealed. Boris Johnson is expected on Monday to announce that loved ones not from the same household or bubble can legally embrace one another from May  - the first time in  months. Mr Johnson is likely to say that everyone should use their “personal judgment” and their “common sense, and it depends on infections remaining low ahead of that key lockdown date, the Sundayreports. Downing Street played down but did not deny the reports last night, claiming no decisions had been made.But Cabinet Office minister Michael Gove confirmed the plan is to restore hugging from May  between friends and family.  “As we move into Stage Three of our roadmap, it will be the case that we will see people capable of meeting indoors, he told the BBCaposs Andrew Marr Show. “And without prejudice to a broader review of social distancing, it is also the case that friendly contact - intimate contact - between friends and family is something we want to see restored.” Askedthat meant hugging from May , he replied: “Yes”. The advice on hugging will be separate to a wider review of social distancing, including in pubs and restaurants - which will only take effect from June  at the earliest. It comes at the same time people in England will be allowed indoor gatherings of up to six people and overnight stays. Mr Johnson had always intended to give an update on hugging ahead of the May  roadmap change, and itaposs thought he will confirm the details in a pm press conference tomorrow. The roadmap said: As soon as possible, and no later than Step , the Government will update its advice on social distancing between friends and family, including hugging. Mr Johnson will remove the -mourner cap on funerals, a month earlier than planned – but there is expected to be a -person limit on weddings, receptions and wakes. Pubs and restaurants, which have endured a torrid  months, will be allowed to reopen their doors to let customers inside - but social distancing measures will stay. Indoor hospitality venues such as cinemas and music venues permitted to open - but they wonapost be able to operate at full capacity just yet. Pubs and restaurants will also be allowed to let customers in, having been permitted to serve punters outdoors for the last month.

again later.When you subscribe we will use the information you provide to send you these newsletters. Your information will be used in accordance with ourPrivacy Notice.Thank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee ourprivacy noticeThe Hartlepool defeat for Labour was upsetting, but it didn’t surprise me. The pandemic squeezed the politics out of the campaign with people in forgiving mood towards the Government following last year’s bad mistakes. Freshly vaccinated voters were showing little anger, just a desire to pull together and get through it all. I say little anger, butI am honest, where I did detect this, it was directed more at Labour than the government. As I revisited areas where I used to receive strong political support, I was told that Labour had lost its way. What do you think  Have your say below Jeremy Corbyn still casts a long shadow. A woman voter in Chaucer Avenue told me: “I cannot believe I am telling you this but I voted Tory because of Corbyn.” When I told her Keir Starmer is very dferent, she snapped back: “You will have to prove it – you can earn my vote before I come back.” There was more like this. The message was clear: Labour needs to get its act together. Locally too, they were disillusioned with Labour councillors who were aloof from them, speaking a language that owed more to far-left platitudes than their everyday lives.  Despite the disappointment of the by-election loss, we are now going to see the re-building of Labour’s reputation locally, and similar fightbacks are taking place in many former Labour strongholds as Starmer supporters gain the upper hand over Corbyn’s army of zealots. ButI take away one abiding impression, it is that in towns like Hartlepool the political kaleidoscope has turned and Labour is not going to recover by attempting to bring back the past. A new model Labour party is being demanded by voters, who themselves have moved on.  In smart and proud former council houses now occupied by their owners, voters want a Labour party that understands their aspiration, believes in social justice, knows this has to be paid for and will ensure that fair rules apply to all – from hard-working welfare recipients to the rich and privileged. They want to be heard, not talked down to, and they want to get behind policies they feel are genuinely useful and relevant to improving their lives. Labour has not spoken to these voters for over a decade since Tony Blair and Gordon Brown were prime ministers. From coronavirus to Brexit, our daily politics newsletter is there to guide you these turbulent times. title: local election results 2021 live
story: NewsLocal election results in full: Summary of all polls in England, Scotland and WalesLabour faced dismal results in England but did better in Wales, while Nicola Sturgeon fell one seat short of an overall majority in Scotland - but demanded an independence vote anyway. This article is being updated with all the results as they come in to SundaymirrorShareCommentsByDan BloomOnline Political EditorLizzy BuchanPolitical Correspondent:,  MAY Updated:,  MAY NewsVotes are being counted across Great Britain - this piece is bringing you all the results from all the polls" %, rgba, rgba, url"Get US and UK politics insight with our free daily email briefing straight to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.When you subscribe we will use the information you provide to send you these newsletters. Your information will be used in accordance with ourPrivacy Notice.Thank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee ourprivacy noticeLabour has plunged into civil war after the Tories demolished a line of Red Wall bricks to claim a stunning victory in Englandaposs elections. Keir Starmeraposs party suffered losses in a swathe of English council seats - including losing control of Durham for the first time in a century - and lost control of Hartlepool for the first time since the s in a by-election. In the Tees Valley mayoral contest, Conservative incumbent Ben Houchen trounced his Labour rival by a landslide, with % of votes to %. The West Midlands mayoral race piled on the agony for Labour as reigning mayor Andy Street was comfortably re-elected. In London, Sadiq Khan edged home with a vote share four points lower than . But there was a mixed picture as Labour pulled off surprise victories in the West of England and Cambridgeshire and Peterborough mayoral elections, ousting Tories. And where - including in Scotland, Wales and some cities - incumbents did well, perhaps due to their sense of authority in the pandemic. Andy Burnham was comfortably re-elected in Greater Manchester with % of the vote, a rise on last time, while Steve Rotheram secured a second term in Liverpool City Region with %. Boris Johnson arrived triumphant in Hartlepool on Friday to meet a blow-up version of himself - but the results are not all rosy for the Tories. While the SNP failed to win a majority in the Scottish Parliament , there is a pro-independence majority as the Greens also won eight seats in Holyrood. That will pile fresh pressure on Boris Johnson, who has called a meeting of Scotland and Walesaposs First Ministers, knowing the Union could be vulnerable. Nicola Sturgeon has vowed to push for - as she calls it - Scotlandaposs undeniable right to hold a new independence vote in the next four years. Meanwhile there was joy for Labour in Wales, where Mark Drakefordaposs party confounded gloomy polls to win half the Senedd seats. The Tories took just one of Walesapos red wall seat - Vale of Clywd - leaving Labour able to lead the Welsh Government. Results will continue to pour in until Sunday, but most of the big ones are now in. So you can keep track, weaposre publishing all the results so far on this article which you canto and refresh to see whataposs what. Please note that while our interactive tools should show full detailed results, our text service only includes highlights or seats changing hands in order to make this article easier to navigate. Text last updated pm Sunday. Graphics update automatically. Big elections  at-a-glance HARTLEPOOL BY-ELECTION: The blockbuster Westminster ballot. The Tories wiped out Labour ’s , majority in the Brexit-backing northern seat - which has been red since its creation in . The Tory majority is now almost double what Labouraposs was before in a historic upset. Result now declared.  ENGLISH COUNCILS: More than , seats were up for grabs on  county,  unitary,  metropolitan and  district councils in England. Tories gained more than  seats at Labouraposs expense - despite many of the seats that were up for election being lost by Labour last time. In a crushing blow, Labour lost control of Durham council after  years, losing  seats. The Tories snatched Harlow in Essex from Labour after seven seats changed hands and took Northumberland from no overall control. Dudley - where Labour and the Tories were practically neck and neck before - went to the Tories with a massive cull of red seats. Conservatives now have  seats, almost double Labouraposs . Labour was stripped of control in Sheffield as the council leader lost his seat and the Conservatives won their first on the authority for  years. Labour also lost nine councillors in Sunderland. Results Friday, Saturday and Sunday. SCOTTISH PARLIAMENT: Nicola Sturgeon fell one seat short of an SNP majority, on  out of . But she demanded an independence referendum in the next four years after the pro-separation Greens also won eight seats. Early results showed SNP gains in key seats including Ayr, East Lothian and Edinburgh Central and a vote share up by .%. But it was not enough of a landslide for an overall majority. Nicola Sturgeon won in her seat but on a slightly reduced vote share, as Labour leader Anas Sarwar notched up more than , votes standing against her. Labour remained in third but defied its internal expectations by winning % of the vote in constituencies and around % in the regional list. Results all declared. WELSH PARLIAMENT: All  seats were up for grabs and polls suggested Labour - while the biggest party - had an uphill struggle to win an overall majority. But the party did not suffer the collapse many feared, or that was seen in England, winning  of the Senedd seats. Only one of Walesapos so-called red wall seats, the Vale of Clwyd, fell to the Welsh Conservatives, and the party also unseated the former Plaid Cymru leader Leanne Wood in Rhondda. First Minister Mark Drakeford will now decide whether to lead a minority government or to form a Labour-led administration with other parties. Results all declared.  ENGLISH MAYORS: The Tories held on in battlegrounds West Midlands and Tees Valley in a major blow to Labour - including a massive % for Tees Valleyaposs Ben Houchen. But in a surprise boost Labour snatched the West of England and Cambridgeshire and Peterborough mayoralties from the Tories - despite only coming third in Cambridgeshire last time. Sadiq Khan was expected to win in London but the margin initially appeared closer than most people thought. West Midlands, West of England and London declare Saturday. LONDON ASSEMBLY: All  seats were up for election and Labour remained dominant. Results mostly declared.  POLICE COMMISSIONERS: The oft-forgotten jobs in England and Wales were up for election for the third time since they were created in . Results through to Monday.  RESULTS IN DETAIL HARTLEPOOL BY-ELECTION Tory Jill Mortimer thrashed Labouraposs Paul Williams with , votes to his ,, declaring: The people have spoken and they’ve made clear it’s time for change. news politics scottish-independence-vote-moves-closer-"" %, rgba, rgba, url"Get US and UK politics insight with our free daily email briefing straight to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.When you subscribe we will use the information you provide to send you these newsletters. Your information will be used in accordance with ourPrivacy Notice.Thank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee ourprivacy noticeScotland is inching closer to a new independence referendum after Nicola Sturgeon warned any attempt to block a vote would be outrageous.The First Minister demanded the right to hold a new separation vote after pro-independence parties won a Scottish Parliament majority - despite the SNP falling one seat short. UK minister Michael Gove today repeatedly refused to rule out trying to block a referendum bid - which could tear apart the Union of the UK - in the Supreme Court.He signalled the UK government would not do so, saying “of course” Scotland is allowed to leave the UK, but refused to clary. Ms Sturgeon said she “heard him say” that the UK government would not fight a legal bid for a referendum in the courts. She intends to press ahead with legislation for a new independence vote, seven years after losing the last one in . Ms Sturgeon said: There is a fundamental issue of democracy here. We have just won a landslide. I am being asked to answer the question aposwhat do you doa UK Government refuses point blank to accept democracyapos. That is just an absurd position for anybody to be put into. She told the BBC’s Andrew Marr Show: “I think it would be absurd and completely outrageousit ever got to that point -it ever got anywhere close to that point. “Because remember, for this to end up in court - which is not something I ever want to see - it would mean a Conservative government had refused to respect the democratic wishes of the Scottish people and the outcome of a democratic election, and tried to go to the Supreme Court to overturn Scottish democracy.” She added any attempt to block a referendum would be “a grave and serious and undemocratic situation” and accused the UK government of showing a “lack of respect for Scottish democracy”.  The SNP won  out of the  seats in the Scottish Parliament, and the pro-independence Greens also won eight seats. Today the triumphant First Minister said there was a clear mandate for an independence vote in the next four years. And SNP deputy leader Keith Brown even signalled Scotland could trigger a wildcat vote. He saidNo scuppered another independence vote, “I believe the referendum will still happen”.Mr Gove repeatedly refused to sayBoris Johnson will try to block a second independence vote in the courts.The Cabinet Office minister was asked three times by Sky Newsthe Prime Minister could go to court to halt any bid from the Scottish Parliament. But rather than ruling it out he said “we’re not going to go there” and “we’re not even going there at the moment.” He also refused to saythere were any circumstances in which Boris Johnson would agree to a second referendum. Instead he replied: Itaposs not an issue for the moment. Of course, the people of Scotland, as we saw in the referendum in , they have that right, but it is absolutely important that we concentrate now on the issues in front of us. Of course, one of the things to bear in mind is that while Nicola Sturgeon obviously secured a good result, the SNP did not get a majority in this election as they did in .

title: mums dying gift means lives
story: NewsMums dying gt means that she lives on through my amazing new friendsWhen her mum died, Ella Murtha, , from Teesside, agreed to donate her organs - and she’s now close friends with two women they savedmirrorShareComments"ByElla Murtha :,  MAY NewsElla has developed a great friendship with Jane and Teresa" %, rgba, rgba, url"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.When you subscribe we will use the information you provide to send you these newsletters. Your information will be used in accordance with ourPrivacy Notice.Thank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee ourprivacy noticeSitting in the Italian restaurant, the three of us laughing and talking, anyone would have thought we’d been close forever.I think of Jane and Teresa as old friends now, introduced to me by my mam. And in a way, that’s true.Without donating Mam’s organs, I’d never have had the chance to make two such amazing friends. My whole world collapsed when my mam Tish died of a brain aneurysm, aged . When I couldn’t get hold of her on Mother’s Day , I drove to her house with my partner Paul.I found her sitting in the kitchen, confused and not herself, so I called an ambulance.We were assured it was simply a water infection, so I kissed her goodbye, saying I’d be back in the morning. Back home, I got a call. Her scan had been reviewed – there was a mass in her brain. By the next morning, she had been diagnosed with the brain aneurysm and slipped into a coma.“I’m afraid she won’t recover,” the consultant said. I heard wailing from somewhere – and realised it was coming from me.I just couldn’t believe that this was happening to my lovely mam. Growing up, it was always just us two. Money was tight but my childhood was full of fun. She loved music, especially classical and jazz, naming me after Ella Fitzgerald. She was a talented social photographer who took thousands of images and had an exhibition of her work in London.Wherever we went, she’d have her camera round her neck and I’d have my own little camera. Mam was an inspiration. She was so happy when I told her she was going to be a grandmother. When Dexter, now nine, was born, her le revolved around him.  The right thing to doAs I tried to process the devastating news that Mam wasn’t coming back, the doctors askedI’d consider organ donation. Though we’d never discussed it, I knew straight away it was the right thing. Mam was spiritual, saying the soul carries on. One of  children, everything was passed on and handed down in Tish’s family. It was as though I could hear her saying she wouldn’t want her organs going to waste.So in the early hours of the following morning, the organ team arrived to go through the donation process. Every single organ had to be agreed – lungs, kidney, pancreas, heart. I was told people can be reluctant to agree to the eyes being donated. But as a photographer, Mam had such good eyes, I wanted someone to benefit from them too.If Mam had to die, I wanted as many people to be helped as possible. For two days I sat with Mam, holding her hand and brushing her hair. It was heart-breaking but I whispered, “Don’t worry, I can do it on my own, you can go.” Then they declared brain stem death, meaning she would never regain consciousness or breathe without support. The following day, Mam’s birthday, I got a call from the donation team. Mam’s organs had been accepted and the recipients would receive them that very day. It was incredibly comforting. A few weeks later, just as I came home with Mam’s ashes, I opened a letter saying that Mam’s “gts” had saved the lives of four other women and the sight of two men. I was absolutely thrilled. I hadn’t expected to hear anything  but a few months later, I got two letters via the donation team. Jane had received Mam’s lungs and Teresa a kidney and pancreas, and they were both full of thanks. I wrote straight back excitedly. Although the donation team doesn’t encourage meeting up, in case the relationship turns sour for any reason, we found each other through social media and stayed in touch.I met up with Jane and her mum when they drove up to see us, and we had the longest hug in the car park.Later, I met Teresa and her family for a day out at Legoland. We all got on really well and it felt so natural.Organ donation law has changed to “presumed consent” but families are still approached before donation goes ahead.% of people are willing to donate their organs, yet only % say they’ve shared their decision. Nine in  families would support organ donationthey knew it was what their loved one wanted. This figure falls to around half when a decision is not known. To find out more, or to register your decision, visit organdonation.nhs.uk

title: delivery mans rapid covid test
story: AdvertorialDelivery mans rapid Covid test outside hospice could have saved livesRegular rapid testing at home is a quick and easy way to help stop the spread of Covid- and protect the people around youmirrorShareByLaura Tait:,  MAY Updated:,  MAY AdvertorialRegular testing now seen as vital to stop the spread of Covid-Alex had no symptoms when he tested positive for Covid- back in February. Around a third of people with coronavirus show no symptoms, so can infect others without even knowing they’ve been ill. Rapid testing is a vital tool to make sure people know when to self isolate so they break the chain of transmission. Alex, , from Hemel Hempstead, works for JamVans, a removal company that provides Covid- tests for its employees. He was experiencing no symptoms at all when he tested positive for Covid. “We move people’s homes on a daily basis, and also have a delivery contract with a local hospice – it has about  charity stores, and we help them move all the stock,” says Alex. “One morning before work I did a rapid Covid- test outside the hospice, then sat in my van waiting for the results. I’d done a few of these tests, and thought it would be fine as I didn’t have a single symptom – but then the test came back positive.”  “I spoke to the hospice on the phone from outside the building, and they told me I had to go for a PCR test. My company booked me in with a private firm and I went straight there. Our company policy is that we have to wear a mask in people’s houses and throughout our offices, and I stick to the guidelines as much as I can, so at first I thought the rapid flow test must be wrong. But within an hour, I was told I definitely had Covid. I couldn’t quite believe it.” Alex was able to isolate straightaway, ensuring he wasn’t spreading Covid to any vulnerable people he came into contact with. “I stopped working to self-isolate on full pay, and still didn’t develop any symptoms at all,” he says. “Without the test, I definitely would have carried on working, which is why it’s so important to have regular tests, evenyou haven’t got any symptoms. I had the virus and I felt fine, but imagineI’d given it to my parents, my grandparents or my colleagues  “If I’m driving between  charity shops, with three or four people in each shop, I could have been quite a spreader. I would have put a lot of people at risk, who may not be as young and healthy as I am – you never know who you’re passing it on to. It might sound dramatic, but in my case, taking the test could have saved lives. I haven’t had the jab yet, but I will as soon as I can – and I’ll still be taking two tests a week.Get into the testing habit More than half the adults in the UK have had at least one dose of Covid vaccination and lockdown restrictions are beginning to ease. But the virus is still out there and around a third of all the people who are infected do not show any symptoms. Regular rapid testing is vital to break the chain of transmission – now all adults are advised to do two tests a week. Rapid testing kits are free and you can do them at home, with results appearing within just  minutes. If you test positive, you’ll be able to isolate straightaway rather than risk spreading Covid to others. Millions of people have already made regular home testing part of their routine, as secondary school children and their parents have been able get free tests since February, but now everyone is encouraged to play their part. Every test helps to put your mind at rest and helps protect people around you as the country moves out of lockdown. Around one in three people with coronavirus has no symptoms. Rapid Covid-tests are for people who aren’t showing symptoms. If you’re showing symptoms , order a PCR test. Test twice a week, or every three or four days: it’s the best way to catch a case of Covid- at the point it becomes highly infectious.If you test positive you should self-isolate immediately and visit nhs.uk get-tested or call  to order a PCR test that will confirm the result.If you test negative, you must still follow the Hands, Face, Space and Fresh Air rules to minimise the spread of Covid-. Rapid tests are easy to use and give results within  minutes. It’s important to report your results online straightaway, whether the test is positive, negative or even void. It’s easy to do at gov.uk report-covid-result or by calling .More than m rapid tests have been taken since October , and hundreds of thousands of positive cases among people with no symptoms have been picked up. Information from the rapid tests is kept anonymous, and scientists use it to spot patterns and outbreaks more quickly and accurately, helping to reduce the risk of future lockdowns. Even though you might have already had one or two doses of vaccine, there’s a chance you could still give Covid to someone , as no vaccine is  per cent effective. So it’s vital to test twice weekly as well as continuing to follow social distancing guidance, washing hands, wearing a face covering and letting fresh air in. Rapid Covid- tests are suitableyou have no symptoms of Covid .“Remember, around a third of people with coronavirus have no symptoms, but could be spreading it to others without knowing,” says GP Dr Amir Khan. “Rapid testing is effective at detecting people who are infectious and enabling us to find Covid- cases that we otherwise would not know about. This helps us in our efforts to stop the spread of the virus. Testing regularly even when you have no symptoms means we can keep infection levels low and our country safe, and the good thing is they give a result within  minutes.” And, as Dr Khan notes, the tests are very reliableyou do them correctly. “Testing ourselves for coronavirus using rapid Covid- tests is vital in keeping ourselves and others safe from coronavirus and keeping infection rates in our communities low. When done correctly, the tests are at least . per cent specic, which means the risk of  positives is extremely low – less than one in a thousand. This means it is a very good test.”‘All I had was a mild sore throat’ Kim Tobin, from Southend, Essex, works in a supermarket and had a positive Covid- test in January  Routine rapid testing in the workplace helped Kim, , discover she had Covid, even though she was showing no symptoms. Without the test, she could have spread it to her workmates and customers.“I had a very, very mild sore throat, just a little scratch and that was it,” she says. “I didn’t even think anything of it. I was all dressed for work, ready to go. Then I went and had the test, and after  minutes the lady who had done it came up to me and said, ‘You need to go home right now because you’ve got it – you’ve tested positive.’”

Your information will be used in accordance with ourPrivacy Notice.Thank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee ourprivacy noticeMeghan Markle and Prince Harryaposs decision not to release a clear photo of son Archie is evidence of the couple apostrollingapos the public, a royal author has claimed. The duke and duchess put out a picture of Archie for his second birthday but it was blurry with a filter over it - so you could barely see the toddler. That compares with the clear and focused pictures that Prince William and Kate Middleton regularly release for their three children - Princess Charlotteaposs recent photo for her th birthday for example. Omid Scobie, who wrote the biography Finding Freedom, says the decision for a blurry and out of focus photo for Archieaposs nd birthday was entirely deliberate. What is your view on this story  Let us know in the comments below This was, as I think weaposve come to experience from the Sussexes, a photo of Archie but not too clear, he said on his On Heir podcast. I think this is their way of trolling the world. When Meghan announced her second pregnancy, she released a picture where she cuddling Archie - but his head was hidden. Omid praised the Sussexes for dressing Archie in jeans and Nikes - saying it was a change from the more more traditional style of his cousins.  A post on the Royal Familyaposs official Instagram and Twitter pages read: Wishing Archie Mountbatten-Windsor a very happy nd birthday today. In another gushing post, shared on the Duke and Duchess of Cambridgeaposs official accounts, Wills and Kate wrote: Wishing Archie a very happy nd birthday today, followed by a balloon and cake emoji. They shared a family snap taken on Archieaposs Christening when he was just two-months old, featuring the entire family together.  Meanwhile Prince Charles and Camilla shared a loving photo of the Prince of Wales with his son and grandson, writing: Happy birthday to Archie, who turns two today. It has been reported that royal aides were left feeling uncomfortable about the fact none of them had an up-to-date photo of Archie with most from shortly after his birth or his christening. Meghan is pregnant with her second child - a girl.

news uk-news how-britains-biggest-family-radfords-"ByBradley JollyDigital journalist:,  May  The biggest family in Britain - the Radfords - spoil every member with balloon-filled teepees and plenty of sweets on their birthdays. Sue and Noel Radford make sure none of their  children is left behind, as adorable photos for daughter Ellieaposs th birthday show. The parents, of Morecambe, Lancashire, wrote on Instagram : It was Ellie’s th birthday yesterday so today we surprised her with this.Happy birthday Ellie we hope you have the best night sweetheart. The couple, who donapost rely on benefits, spend an estimated £, a year of their own money bringing up their children - including birthdays with a reported budget of £ per child and Christmas at £ to £ per child. They say on the morning of each of their kidsapos birthdays, the whole family gather in the living room. The child is given a pile of presents, which often include sweets, clothes, toys and sports gear. These gts are usually from the whole family, rather than  dferent gts from each sibling. Sue, , fancies herself as a demon wrapper and is the one in charge of wrapping and hiding the kidsapos pressies. But Noel, a professional baker who runs his own bakery, usually whips up the birthday cake at the family house, which used to be a care home.   The family sometimes buys extra-special cakes for milestone birthdays. Before lockdown, the supersized family enjoyed birthday meals in restaurants, cocktails and even holidays. The weekly food bill for the family usually comes in at around £ but they splash out even more for birthdays, treating the kids to a meal out or ordering a huge takeaway for everyone. When Millie turned  last August, Sue wrote on Instagram: “Massive happy birthday to @millieeradfordd  today. Have a brilliant day sweetheart. “Enjoying a cocktail with @itschloeradford_makeup for her birthday tomorrow.”The mum also visits the grave of her th child, Alfie, who was sadly stillborn in , every year. Read more

title: im using 12000 onlyfans money
story: NewsIm using £, OnlyFans money to buy a London bus and turn it into a homeHayley Rowson, from Abergele in Wales, has earned enough money selling raunchy pictures online to reduce her working hours and buy a London bus to convert into a homemirrorShareCommentsByAaran Lennox:,  MAY Updated:,  MAY NewsHayley Rowson from Abergele with her London bus " %, rgba, rgba, url"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.When you subscribe we will use the information you provide to send you these newsletters. Your information will be used in accordance with ourPrivacy Notice.Thank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee ourprivacy noticeA -year-old woman says she has earned enough money selling raunchy pictures online to reduce her working hours and buy a London bus to convert into a home. Hayley Rowson, from Abergele in Wales, claims to have earned almost £, since the start of the year by uploading pictures and videos to the OnlyFans website.The courier delivery driver has also been able to reduce her working hours since she began selling photographs and footage, priced from £ and a subscription fee of £. per month, reports the Daily Post. With the money she has made so far, Hayley has recently purchased a red London bus for £, and is in the process of converting it in order to move from her home in Abergele and live on the road with her three cats and dog. Hayley said: Iaposve had a bad few years, recently selling my house after financial dficulties Iaposve always liked the idea of living on the road. Initially I was looking at a container conversion but liked the idea of a bus. I approached a bus company in Holywell and asked themthey had any busses they would like to sell - thankfully, they had the London bus as it does not comply with guidelines from local councils so it wasnapost being used. My OnlyFans success, I think is mainly down to the fact that I talk to my subscribers and I answer their messages promptly. Effectively itaposs like a business, so regardless of the industry, customer service is key. I upload at least three times per day to ensure my content is fresh and people are getting value for their money.  People need to realise that there is more to le than working early hours until late at night, there are other ways to make money and your body is the biggest asset you have, people should be proud to show it off. I think that living for a mortgage is a thing of the past, people like to enjoy themselves, and by going part time in my job that I was once working six days a week in now allows me to have that freedom. OnlyFans isn’t just about the money it’s about the freedom to do whatever I want.

title: i owe life double lung
story: NewsI owe my le to double lung transplant - but the op gave me incurable bugEXCLUSIVE: Devastated Keit Hurworth feels like his donated lungs will have been wastedhe does not hold the hospital to account because they knew there was a deadly bug in the watermirrorShareCommentsByGrace MacaskillNorthern feature writer:,  MAY Updated:,  MAY NewsKeith Hurworth thought he was being given a second chance at le after his lung transplant, but it was a death sentence ,callToAction:ltpgtGet weekly highlights from Mirror editor Alison Phillips direct to your emaillt pgt,buttonText:,contentId:,newsletterImage:https:i-prod.mirror article.ece ALTERNATES sd _AlisonHeaderFinal.png,endpointUrl:https:response.pure interface list.php,profile:Reach_Mirror,isPureNewsLetter:true,pureMailingListId:Mirror - Alisons Newsletter,isDoubleOptIn:,newsletterSiteName:Mirror" %, rgba, rgba, url"Get weekly highlights from Mirror editor Alison Phillips direct to your emailInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.When you subscribe we will use the information you provide to send you these newsletters. Your information will be used in accordance with ourPrivacy Notice.Thank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee ourprivacy noticeA transplant patient has told of his anger after picking up a deadly bug at the hospital that saved him. Keith Hurworth, , is one of  patients who contracted Mycobacterium Abscessus at the Royal Papworth Hospital – one of whom died. The bug, which is found in infected water, stays in the body and can attack the lungs and eat into bones. Keith, who was in hospital for a double lung transplant, has been told there is no cure or effective treatment for it. Andhis new lungs fail, the bug prevents him having a second transplant. The dad-of-two now wants to know why he was admitted for his op five months after the world-famous Royal Papworth declared a serious incident. Tell us what you think of this story in the comments below The infection was found in the hospital’s water supply soon after it moved to a site next to nearby Addenbrooke’s Hospital in Cambridge. Keith says he was not told about the bug before his double transplant in February . Five lung transplant patients were infected, and  people with serious lung conditions. The bug was first identied in August  and a serious incident was declared by the NHS Trust the following month.  But Keith says the first he knew about the problem was last May, when a doctor told him he was infected. Keith, from Cotgrave, near Nottingham, said: “I owe my le to Papworth but I don’t understand why they didn’t tell me. “When doctors told me I was infected, they were in tears. Everyone was so upset. I deserved to know there had been this bug in the water.” Married Keith, who is dad to Liam, , and Libby, , is now taking legal action. The Mirroraposs newsletter brings you the latest news, exciting showbiz and TV stories, sport updates and essential political information.The newsletter is emailed out first thing every morning, at noon and every evening. Never miss a moment by signing up to our newsletter here.  He said: “I am worried sick. It has made my depression worse and I feel I am back at square one. I am scared to go outside. I was given the gt of le and I feel like I owe it to the person who I got the lungs from to get solicitors involved. “Otherwise it feels like the lungs have been wasted.” Keith worked with cement and suffered breathing problems for years. He learned he had been infected when he went for a post-op check-up. He added: “It was devastating for me, my we and the children. I’ve been told I can’t have another transplant because once the infection is in your body, not a lot can be done.  “The bug is sitting dormant at the moment. But when it starts up, I might have only months to live. “The only drug is one that slows it down. That this outbreak has not just affected me but others as well is worrying. My family feel very upset and angry. I feel a terrible conflict in going to lawyers, but I wasn’t told about the bug. I am trying to understand why. “I deserve to knowmore could have been done to prevent me falling ill.”  Keith was also put through the wringer by Covid but a steroid drug saved his le. Clare Pearson, of lawyers Irwin Mitchell, said: “This has had a major impact on Keith and caused great concern among other patients. While we welcome the fact the Trust identied areas for future action, it is worrying that Keith contracted his infection six months after the first cases were identied.”

title: i want meet cannibal who
story: NewsI want to meet cannibal who killed my sister and ate her leg so I can look him in eyesEXCLUSIVE: Michael Paterson aims to sit down with David Harker after he strangled Julie Paterson, , in  and ate her leg in a scene police likened to Silence of the LambsmirrorShareCommentsByDan WarburtonReporter for the Sunday Mirror and People:,  MAY NewsMurder victim Julie Patersons leg was eaten by cannibal David Harker" %, rgba, rgba, url"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.When you subscribe we will use the information you provide to send you these newsletters. Your information will be used in accordance with ourPrivacy Notice.Thank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee ourprivacy noticeThe brother of a mum killed by a cannibal wants to meet him, “look him in the eyes” – and find out what he did with her body. Michael Paterson aims to sit down face-to-face with David Harker as part of the restorative justice programme. Harker strangled Julie Paterson, , in  and ate her leg in a scene police likened to Silence of the Lambs, in which Sir Anthony Hopkins played killer Hannibal Lecter. For more than two decades Harker has refused to reveal what he did with other body parts – even taunting his victim’s family from prison with cruel notes. Grieving Michael, , told the Sunday People: “I want to go to prison, look Harker in the eyes, and demand to know what he did with my sister. What is your view  Have your say in the comment section “I can’t move on with my le until I know. He is sick. I want him to tell me what he did with Julie’s body so I can move on with my le. He shouldn’t be released until that happens.” Harker, then aged , pleaded guilty to the manslaughter of Julie in Darlington on the grounds of diminished responsibility. A judge at Teesside crown court sentenced him to le imprisonment with a recommendation that he should not be eligible for parole for at least  years.  But he could be freeda parole board deems he is no longer a risk. However, Michael claims Harker “prevented the lawful and decent burial” of his sister, a mother of four. And he intends to lodge a complaint with police which he hopes could spark a fresh investigation and prolong Harker’s time in prison – unless he reveals what he did with Julie’s remains. Her family raised the possibility of quizzing Harker after prison chiefs included details of the rehab process in an information pack.  No cannibal has ever been involved in a restorative justice meeting. Any summit could be part of a new parole bid – but Harker will have to agree to the meeting. A source said: “It would clearly need to be a highly secure meeting.  Harker’s crimes were unspeakable.” Restorative justice is aimed at helping victims and perpetrators. It involves offenders and people affected by the crime quizzing each other in an effort to move forward with their lives – and prevent further crimes. will use the information you provide to send you these newsletters. Your information will be used in accordance with ourPrivacy Notice.Thank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee ourprivacy noticeTo mark the start of Mental Health Awareness Week, the British Asian Trust and CareTech Foundation are jointly urging the British-Pakistani population to recognise and de-stigmatise mental health within their communities. I wholly support this initiative. With my own Asian background, I have experienced first-hand the devastating affect mental health has on people when it is a taboo subject – misunderstood, ignored and brushed under the carpet. We cannot allow this situation to carry on because not recognising the importance of mental health has a wider impact on all society. My parents and countless other first-generation British Pakistanis grew up in a culture that doesn’t acknowledge mental health. I remember my own trauma when I realised I might be made to marry someone my parents chose for me. What do you think  Have your say in comments below  It consumed my thoughts as an -year-old. I couldn’t talk to my parents about it because they would have been ashamed of me, and I couldn’t talk to my teachers and friends because they didn’t understand my culture. So I had no outlet for those feelings of fear, anxiety, anger and helplessness. Shockingly, in Pakistan, families often turn to spiritual healers, who associate mental illness with supernatural forces such as witchcraft, possession and black magic.  A child showing signs of misbehaviour or a woman not adhering to the cultural norms would be taken to one of these healers to rid them of the “gin” or evil spirit. The UK has accessible mental health services with more than , registered therapy professionals. Yet many in the UK’s Pakistani communities don’t reach out for help for fear of judgement. In one UK study, middle-aged Pakistani men and older Indian and Pakistani women reported signicantly higher rates of depression than white people. It angers me that the western-educated Pakistani Prime Minister Imran Khan has not used his  to address the mental health of his population, which could in turn have a positive impact on the Asian community here in the UK. Your information will be used in accordance with ourPrivacy Notice.Thank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee ourprivacy noticeMeghan Markle wore a stunning Cartier Tank Française watch for a TV appearance last night in a touching tribute to Princess Diana.Duchess of Sussex, , subtly highlighted her connection to the mother-in-law she never met during an interview on Vax Live telecast. Princess Diana regularly wore the gold Cartier Tank Française watch for engagements in the s and itaposs believed Meghan was a fan of the same style before she joined the royals and bought her own while she was working as an actress. Diana was pictured at ious s wearing the square-faced watch, reportedly given to her by her father, the th Earl Spencer. After Diana died in , the watch belonged to Prince William but it is believed he gave it to Harry in or around .  During the TV interview last night - the first since the Oprah bombshell in March - wore Dianaaposs watch, a move described by many as a way to send a message of appreciation back to the royal family.Itaposs lovely sheaposs wearing Dianaaposs old watch, one social media user wrote. Credit Meghan, sheaposs showing her appreciation to the royal family there, added another.  Speaking about the watch she bought with her money from Suits, Meghan previously said she intends to give it to her daughter, whose due to be born this summer.She told Hello Magazine : Iaposve always coveted the Cartier French Tank watch.I had it engraved on the back, aposTo M.M. From M.M.apos and I plan to give it to my daughter one day. Thataposs what makes pieces special, the connection you have to them. Meghan appeared on TV to give a pre-recorded message ahead of the Vax Live concert, which took place at Los Angelesapos Lo-Fi stadium.Prince Harry appeared in person, but his partner is heavily pregnant.In the message, Meghan said: The past year has been defined by communities coming together tirelessly and heroically to tackle Covid-. Weaposve gathered tonight because the road ahead is getting brighter, but itaposs going to take every one of us to find our way forward.

the information you provide to send you these newsletters. Your information will be used in accordance with ourPrivacy Notice.Thank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee ourprivacy noticeMeghan Markle has appeared on TV for the first time since her and Prince Harryaposs bombshell interview with Oprah Winfrey. The Duchess of Sussex appeared as part of the Global Citizen VAX Live concert with a pre-recorded video message in which she said women had been disproportionately impacted by Covid-. The event, televised on Saturday night in the US, also featured performances from Jenner Lopez, Eddie Vedder, Foo Fighters, J Balvin and H.E.R. In her message, Meghan said: The past year has been defined by communities coming together tirelessly and heroically to tackle Covid-. Weaposve gathered tonight because the road ahead is getting brighter, but itaposs going to take every one of us to find our way forward. As campaign chairs of Vax Live, my husband and I believe itaposs critical that our recovery prioritises the health, safety and success of everyone - and particularly women, who have been disproportionately affected by this pandemic.Do you enjoy reading about the royal family for all the best royal news from the Mirror here The pregnant duchess added: Women, and especially women of colour, have seen a generation of economic gain wiped out. Since the pandemic began, nearly . million women have lost work in the US, and  million more women around the world are expected to slip into extreme poverty. Meghan, wearing her hair loose over her shoulder and cradling her stomach, said: My husband and I are thrilled to soon be welcoming a daughter.  Itaposs a feeling of joy we share with millions of other families around the world. When we think of her, we think of all the young women and girls around the globe who must be given the ability and the support to lead us forward. Earlier this week, Harry and Meghan wrote an open letter to the chief executives of pharmaceutical companies like Pfizer, Moderna and AstraZeneca urging them to redouble their support for the UN-sponsored Covax programme. The couple have called on all firms to temporarily suspend intellectual property rights applied to Covid vaccines, and for a global public-private collaboration so production methods for the jabs can be shared.

title: model scarred life after woman
story: NewsModel scarred for le after woman stabs her in face with screwdriver in revenge attackWARNING: GRAPHIC IMAGES Stacy Dolan, who was kned three times with a screwdriver by Sharon Mather near Wigan, Greater Manchester, suffered a puncture wound to her face in the nasty and unpleasant incidentmirrorShareCommentsByAlec WhitakerBradley JollyDigital journalist:,  MAY NewsStacy Dolan, , was kned three times with a screwdriver " %, rgba, rgba, url"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.When you subscribe we will use the information you provide to send you these newsletters. Your information will be used in accordance with ourPrivacy Notice.Thank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee ourprivacy notice A glamour model has been left scarred for le after she was stabbed with a screwdriver by another woman in a revenge attack.Stacy Dolan, , suffered a puncture wound to the left side of the face below the eye, a cm laceration on the left knee, and bruising and swelling to the upper right arm after the attack. She was stabbed by -year-old Sharon Mather, who had confronted her inside her own home and accused her of taking advantage of a friend who gave the victim money. Now Ms Dolan, who has posed for a string of publications including Front magazine, Twisted Edge and the Daily Sport, claims she is disfigured and can no longer pose for close up facial pictures due to a scar on her lip. The mum of two, from Wigan, Greater Manchester, said: Since the incident, it has affected my confidence and the way I am. It has made me more conscious of being alone. I now no longer use my front door to enter or leave my house. My injuries have healed but the injury to my face has left me feeling like I have nerve damage to my top lip, it feels like I always have a fat lip. There is still a slight scar that can be seen close up but can be covered with makeup. However, I am aware of the fact that I have this scar and I am now really conscious of it. I am also conscious of how this has affected my modelling career and I know now that I can no longer accept work that requires me to have close up face shots. I have two small scars on my leg that I am conscious of. I also feel the scar on my face may have lost me work.  Mather, a former carer, was jailed for five and a half years at Bolton Crown Court after she was convicted of causing grievous bodily harm with intent. The jury heard Mather was drunk and angry when she repeatedly attacked Ms Dolan in Wigan, while one of the victimaposs young kids slept upstairs. Sentencing the thug, judge Miss Recorder Alexandra Simmonds told her: You were intent on remonstrating with Miss Dolan because you thought she had taken advantage of a friend of yours. It seemed you were drunk and angry and you started arguing with some money which she had taken from your friend. Miss Dolan did not know what you were talking about at first and wanted you to leave. The two of you had been friends before this night, but something had clearly upset you. The state you were in meant you were not prepared to listen to her. You had a screwdriver in your hand, you struck out at her several times causing three wounds. It was the final injury to her face that perhaps brought you to your senses as you then fled the property, realising what a terrible thing you had done. Miss Dolan sought help from a neighbour and the police were called yet you roamed the streets and ended up at the house of an elderly gentleman who you had cared for in the past. He was extremely concerned about the state that you were in and he thought you had taken drugs or been very drunk. You told him that you had stabbed Miss Dolan and at first, he didnapost believe you. He advised you to go to the police, but you didnapost. Instead, you left his house and hid at a friendaposs house. You turned yourself in a few days later, your friend was concerned you might commit suicide. Miss Dolan is more conscious about being alone in the house, while her injuries have healed, she has some altered sensation in her top lip and there is a slight scar from her face, which she is conscious of because of her modelling career. It is clear you regret your decision to go round to Miss Dolanaposs house that night and I am prepared to accept that your behaviour that night was wholly out of character - almost certainly having been affected by the alcohol you had drank that night. You are going to find the prison environment very dficult to cope with given your mental health dficulties.  The jury heard Ms Dolan and Mather fell out in July  when Mather believed Miss Dolan had taken money from a mutual friend. In the early hours of July  that year, Mather went round to Ms Dolanaposs home and the attack followed. As the victim ran to a neighbouraposs home for help, Mather fled the scene and went to the home of an elderly man she previously cared for and confessed she had stabbed the victim. He advised her to go to police but Mather instead hit at another friendaposs house before surrendering to police a few days later. She later denied wrongdoing. Katie Jones, prosecuting, said: This was a sustained assault on one victim who sustained three injuries. There were children present, but they were asleep upstairs. The offence was committed whilst the defendant was drunk or possibly high. At the time Miss Dolan had been starting out in her modelling career.

title: nathaniels family just three days
story: NewsNathaniels family have just three days to raise £, for le-saving operationEXCLUSIVE: Celebs including Simon Cowell, David Walliams, Katie Price, Paul O’Grady and Coleen Nolan are backing race against time to get acute myeloid leukaemia sufferer Nathaniel Nabena, , le-saving stem cell transplant he is not entitled to for free on the NHSmirrorShareCommentsByAmy SharpeSunday Mirror reporterHalina WattsEmma Pryer:,  MAY Updated:,  MAY NewsSunday People readers helped raise £, for three rounds of chemo at Great Ormond Street Hospital in March to get Nathaniel in shape for the le-saving op - but time is running out" %, rgba, rgba, url"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.When you subscribe we will use the information you provide to send you these newsletters. Your information will be used in accordance with ourPrivacy Notice.Thank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee ourprivacy noticeSimon Cowell and David Walliams are backing our ­campaign to save Nathaniel Nabena – as his family race to raise £, in three days. The big-hearted Britain’s Got Talent stars have each given five-figure sums to help the nine-year-old, after we ­revealed his parents must raise £, by Wednesday for a le-saving stem cell transplant. Manchester United and Marvel fan Nathaniel is not entitled to free NHS treatment because he is not a British national.He was diagnosed with acute myeloid leukaemia in the UK after flying here for a £, prosthetic eye fitted privately after losing it to a tumour in his home country Nigeria. Simon, , whose son Eric is seven, said: “This must be a really dficult time for Nathaniel and his parents, let’s all pray that this campaign gets Nathaniel the treatment he needs.” Comedian David, , dad to Alfred, aged eight, said: “Nathaniel is a very special little boy and we must do everything we can to ensure he gets all the treatment he needs so he can enjoy a long and happy le.”You can add to the donations to help save Nathaniel via this GoFundMe pageGenerous Sunday People readers helped raise £, earlier this year for three rounds of chemo at Great Ormond Street Hospital in March to get him in shape for the le-saving op. He responded better than consultants expected and is in remission and in a position for a transplant, using donor stem cells from an umbilical cord. Readers have helped raise another £, last week to fund transplant procedure and doctors at GOSH have kindly waived their private fees to ­reduce the cost. But there is still another £, to find. Consultants at GOSH say his cancer couldat any time and the window for a successful op while chemotherapy is keeping the cancer at bay means the cash must be raised by Wednesday.  After that, the chances of it working will be reduced, and Nathaniel’s only likely option will be palliative care. A host of stars have rallied around to support Nathaniel as the family race to raise cash. Former JLS singer Aston Merrygold, Paul O’Grady and Loose Women’s Coleen Nolan were among those backing the lad.Dad-of-two Aston, , shared the appeal with his k Instagram followers, urging them: “Please help Nathaniel’s family”.Reality star Katie Price shared a fundraising page with her . million Instagram followers and called for fans to “give Nathaniel the chance for a le”.Nathaniel said he is “so grateful” for the support from readers and celebs. He said: “Thank you all, everybody, for helping me and giving me a chance at le. God bless everybody.” His parents Ebi, , and Modupe, , have been moved to tears by the support from stars and People readers.  Ebi said: “I’ve been crying knowing that the British people have given my son another hope in le again when all hope was gone. It is like a modern day miracle. We are so grateful. “We all watch American Idol as a family and Nathaniel watches videos of Simon on TikTok. He is a big fan. To David we say, thank you so much for coming to the aid of a stranger and being a Good Samaritan. We have still got to raise three-quarters of what we need. I have not been able to sleep, I worry so much about how we are going to raise the money. It is so tough.” This week, Nathaniel had tests and saw a psychologist at GOSH ahead of the potential transplant and rested at his relatives’ home in Croydon, South London. Ebi said: “So far the test results have been wonderful. He’s in top shape, he’s doing so well. He’s been playing his video games. “He knows he’s going to be in hospital for a long time and expressed his fears in a meeting with a psychologist. We are doing our best to reassure him.” Nathaniel has already overcome a lot after having his left eye removed last September while fighting another cancer, myeloid sarcoma, in southern Nigeria. His family raised £, so he could travel with Ebi to London to have a prosthetic fitted at London’s Moorfield Eye Hospital in November. Within days of arriving Nathaniel suffered nosebleeds and a fever and was rushed to Croydon University Hospital where he was diagnosed with terminal AML, which affects around  children every year in the UK. It is so aggressive he could have died within weeks without chemo. His family were initially told the total cost of the treatment at GOSH would be up to £,.  Celebrities have voiced their concern for Nathaniel after learning of his desperate situation. Corrie legend Beverley Callard: “This little boy deserves all the help we can give him, so let’s dig deep and get him the treatment he needs to save his le”.Emmerdale’s Claire King: “Please, please help Nathaniel’s family raise £,. Stay strong, Nathaniel. We are all wishing you the very best.”Coleen Nolan, Loose Women list: “What Nathaniel is going through is every family’s worst nightmare. They are so close to the treatment he desperately needs, and the kindness of strangers can help him.”Benidorm’s Sherrie Hewson: “Every child deserves the best chance at le, and while there is hope for Nathaniel, we mustn’t give up. He has shown such bravery coming this far and now he needs a chance at the treatment that could save him. I hope everyone will get behind this courageous little boy and his family to donate and give him a future.”Samantha Giles, Hollyoaks actress: “If you can manage to donate just a pound, it could potentially save Nathaniel’s le. Thank you, thank you! You’ve done something wonderful.”Entrepreneur and presenter Saira Khan: “If we can all give a little bit, we can help to save this little boy’s le.” TV and stage star Claire Sweeney: “GOSH consultants have graciously waived their fee, but we still need to raise £, for a le-saving stem cell treatment. Please dig deep – we only have three days to save this beautul boy.” The transplant treatment is not available in his home country and he was too sick to travel. Ebi and Modupe were in despair when they first spoke to us three months ago. But Sunday People readers stepped in to raise £, for chemo which has given him a chance of surviving a transplant. Clinicians have lowered costs after Nathaniel responded better than expected to treatment and needed less chemo.  And last week we revealed consultants at GOSH have waived their private fees to help Nathaniel. The £, covers the donor stem cell transplant and the cost of care, excluding consultants fees, based on a typical inpatient admission of eight weeks and a three-month post-transplant follow-up as an outpatient. Professor Ajay Vora, a consultant paediatric haematologist at GOSH, said: “All the consultants involved in his care are working in a private ­capacity and have waived their fee because they want to help him. “Our time is not borrowed from the NHS because we are treating Nathaniel in our private service in our time.”  If enough is raised for the transplant, Nathaniel will undergo tests to begin the process on Friday, May . Doctors had hoped to have a bone marrow transplant from one of his two sisters Nadia, , and Nicole,  months. But they were not a match. Ebi said: “Even to get to this point where we may have access to treatment is a miracle. We’d given up hope.”Add to the donations to help save Nathaniel via the GoFundMe pageOperation saved Ava’s le

use the information you provide to send you these newsletters. Your information will be used in accordance with ourPrivacy Notice.Thank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee ourprivacy noticeA pregnant single mum has been moved into a rat-infested council house after bravely fleeing her home due to domestic abuse. Sian Hope* and her two-year-old daughter were living in a refuge after escaping their previous lives with just the clothes on their backs in September. Birmingham City Council then offered them a two-bed end-terrace property, though they were unable to view it before moving in thanks to Covid restrictions.But nothing could have prepared Sian - who is expecting her second child in July - for what they found, reports Birmingham Live. She has described being kept awake at night by the scratching sounds, and being unable to leave food out in the kitchen. They have also seen tails scurrying along the skirting boards. We were really excited when we were offered the house but we couldnapost believe it when we moved in, Sian said.Are you in a similar predicament to Sian  Let us know at webnews@mirrorIt has a major rat and mice infestation, broken floorboards, no carpets and the loft is rotten. There are rooms with no skirting boards and gaps between the wall and the floor so big that you can see rat tails poking through as they run along. I can see the rats urinating in the walls and it seeping onto the floors. Every day I’m bleaching my kitchen. My daughter is scared to be in her own bedroom. All you can hear is scratching. The rats and mice go crazy in the loft at night. It wakes her up, she’s petried.  Sian said her clothes have been chewed and rats have bitten through the cables on her fridge freezer and broken it. She claims the council has refused to replace it, meaning she has to live off microwave meals and largely seek refuge in her bedroom where there is carpet. The council said it has sent pest control to bait all areas concerned, is planning to carry out rodent proofing works and has promised to continue to monitor and treat the property until there is no more bait being consumed. But Sian says the treatments have so far failed to have any impact, and droppings are everywhere - and dead rodents are being left for days.  Over the Bank Holiday, Sian was awoken at am to the sound of an injured mouse thrashing around inside a vase - only to be told she would have to wait until Tuesday for someone to come out. Sian said neighbours have told her there has been a rodent problem in the three-house terrace for three years, and it appears to stem from her property. My house is disgusting. I’m calling the council every other day. I’ve sent so many emails and complaints, she said. On top of the rodents, there are also heating problems with the boiler switching itself off each night meaning Sian and her daughter have constant coughs and chest infections. The health visitor has been and said it is not safe, she added.

Your information will be used in accordance with ourPrivacy Notice.Thank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee ourprivacy notice A royal expert claims Prince Charlesapos birthday message for his grandson Archie could have been a deliberate snub to Meghan Markle.Clarence Houseaposs Instagram and Twitter accounts shared a sweet black and white photo of Prince Harry beaming as he cradled baby Archie, with proud Charles looking on.The caption on Thursdayaposs post stated: Happy birthday to Archie, who turns two today.Royal fans asked why Charles didnapost share a photo that included Archieaposs mum Meghan, the Daily Star Online reported, while others wondered why the future kingaposs official Instagram account didnapost share similar posts on Princess Charlotte and Prince Louisapos birthdays recently. Royal commentator Duncan Larcombe told Fabulous magazine that omitting Meghan from the photo could be a “deliberate” snub following Megxit and the Sussexesapos bombshell interview with Oprah Winfrey. Do you enjoy reading about the royal family  for all the best royal news from the Mirror here He said: “It’s pretty daft to leave her [Meghan] out of it given that it wasn’t that many weeks ago she was American TV throwing accusations about the royal family left, right and centre. “I see that as a deliberate sign of Prince Charles. “Surely Prince Charles has enough nous to know how sensitive the situation is with his younger son and his we. “I’d be very surprisedPrince Charles didn’t know exactly what he was doing.” He suggested the photo may have been chosen as Charlesapos favourite or it was likely one of the few pictures that he has showing him with Archie. It is thought that Charles, , hasnapost seen his grandson in person for at least  months. Keep up to date with all the latest news from the Queen, Charles, William, Kate, Harry, Meghan, George, Charlotte, Louis, Archie and the rest of the family. Weaposll send the best Royal news directly to your inbox so you never have to miss a thing.to our newsletter here. Harry and Meghan moved to Canada in late  when Archie was about six months old, and then to Los Angeles as they quit their roles as senior royals. While some saw the post from Clarence House as a possible olive branch to the Sussexes amid a rt between them and the Royal Family, Mr Larcombe didnapost see it that way. In the comments section under the Instagram post, royal fans asked why the Clarence House account didnapost post similar messages recently when Charlotte turned six, Louis turned three and Prince William and Kate Middleton celebrated their tenth wedding anniversary.

title: queens cousin prince michael accused
story: NewsQueens cousin Prince Michael accused of using royal status to sell access to PutinAn undercover investigation claims the Queens cousin Prince Michael of Kent said he could be hired for £, a day to make "confidential" representations to Russia President Vladimir Putins regimemirrorShareCommentsByTaz AliRyan MerrieldReporter:,  MAY Updated:,  MAY NewsPrince Michael of Kent denies the allegations relating to Vladimir Putin " %, rgba, rgba, url"Get our daily royal round-up direct to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.When you subscribe we will use the information you provide to send you these newsletters. Your information will be used in accordance with ourPrivacy Notice.Thank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee ourprivacy noticeAn undercover investigation has claimed Prince Michael of Kent was willing to use his royal status for personal profit, and to seek favours from Russian president Vladimir Putin. The Queenaposs cousin told undercover reporters posing as investors from South Korea in a virtual meeting that he could be hired for £, a day to make confidential representations to Mr Putinaposs regime.The revelation was made by Channel  Dispatches in collaboration with the Sunday Times, who set up a fake South Korean gold company called House of Haedong and approached five members of the royal family with an offer of a role.Prince Michael of Kent responded showing interest in working with the company, telling undercover reporters that he would give House of Haedong his royal endorsement in a recorded speech for a £, fee and was happy to use his home in Kensington Palace as a backdrop. Prince Michael is not a working member of the royal family and does not receive money from the civil list. He and his we occasionally attend royal garden parties and receptions.He earns a living acting as chairman of his own private company, which offers consultancy advice. Prince Michael was also approached about a role helping the fictitious gold firm in Russia.Do you enjoy reading about the royal family for all the best royal news from the Mirror here The programme said his business partner Lord Simon Reading had used an event at Kensington Palace in , in which Prince Michael was a guest, to sell access to Mr Putin. The event, to promote the Russian wrestling sport of Sambo, also offered opportunities to personally meet the Russian leader at a later date, Dispatches found. In a recorded meeting with the undercover reporters, Lord Reading said: If heis representing the House of Haedong, he could mention that to Putin and Putin would find the right person who is interested in South Korea or interested in gold. It just opens the door, you know, which is so helpful. He added: I think,I can say this, this is kind of slightly discreet, weaposre talking relatively discreetly here. Because we wouldnapost want the world to know that he is seeing Putin purely for business reasons,you follow me.  He went on to describe Prince Michael as Her Majestyaposs unofficial ambassador to Russia, and that tension between the UK and the Russian regime has not affected his relationship with Mr Putin. In a preview clip shared by Channel  on Twitter, Prince Michael is seen being asked,is acceptable, to which he says: Oh yes, very much so. Thank you, yes. Erm, very good. Thank you so much, yes. One of the reporters then asksit is in line with what he would normally charge for a speech like this. He replies: Yes, indeed, so. I have no, no questions for you on that. I am very happy with your suggestion. And erm I think that’s very good and very generous of you. Responding to programme, Prince Michaelaposs office said: Prince Michael receives no public funding and earns his own living through a consultancy company that he has run for over  years. Prince Michael has no special relationship with President Putin. They last met in June  and Prince Michael has had no contact with him or his office since then. Lord Reading is a good friend, who in trying to help, made suggestions which Prince Michael would not have wanted, or been able, to fulfil. Lord Reading said: I thought the approach from the House of Haedong was genuine and I was only trying to facilitate an introduction to my friend Prince Michael. I made a mistake and over-promised and for that, I am truly regretful. I wasnapost at my peak as I was recovering from a kidney transplant.  For the record, the Sambo event which was eight years ago was my event and Prince Michael was simply my guest along with many other people. Simon Astaire, spokesman for Prince Michael, went on to tell the Mirror: Prince Michael has long established business, charitable and cultural connections with Russia and is proud of all the work he has done for UK-Russia trade. As is standard practice, Prince Michael’s Private Secretary made it clear to the company’s representatives during their conversations that nothing could proceed without the agreement of the British Embassy and the help of the Russo-British Chamber of Commerce, of which Prince Michael is Patron.  Cantium Services, Prince Michaelaposs consultancy company has built up accumulated losses and continues to operate at a loss. There is therefore no corporation tax liability to pay. Prince Michael met President Alexander Lukashenko in October  during a visit to Minsk. The meeting was arranged and attended by the British Ambassador to Belarus. The visit was supported in full by the FCDO. Prince Michael is not currently conducting any business in Belarus.

story: NewsUK weather: Brits brave heavy rain and winds to hit pub beer gardens in weekend washoutThe UK experienced a wet start to the weekend, with showers covering most parts of the country. Sunday will be much warmer, although some areas are still expected to be wet, the Met Office saidmirrorShareCommentsByChiara Fiorillo:,  MAY NewsA group of friends enjoyed a birthday celebration despite rainy conditions in Sunderland " %, rgba, rgba, url"Get our daily coronavirus email newsletter with all the news you need to know direct to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.When you subscribe we will use the information you provide to send you these newsletters. Your information will be used in accordance with ourPrivacy Notice.Thank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee ourprivacy noticeEager Brits braved cold temperatures, heavy rain and strong winds to spend time at pub beer gardens yesterday. The UK experienced a wet start to the weekend, with showers covering most parts of the country.Wales was particularly wet and the Met Office issued a yellow warning for rain in southern areas of the country, urging drivers to be careful when on the road.But despite the rainfall and cold temperatures, Brits wrapped up and still hit the pubs, sitting under umbrellas with their friends and family outdoors.Under current coronavirus restrictions in England, hospitality venues can only open outdoors until May , when they will be allowed to welcome customers indoors too.A group of women enjoyed a wet and windy birthday celebration at a beer garden in Sunderland, using umbrellas to repair themselves from the rain as they drank their pints. A woman armed herself with a coat and a scarf as she enjoyed a drink in Sheffield in the morning.Pub beer gardens in Leeds also looked busy despite the poor weather, with people queuing under the rain and waiters using raincoats to serve food and drinks.The Met Office warned Brits that Saturday would be a wet day, with clouds and rain covering most parts of the UK, especially in the morning. Southern England turned drier in the afternoon as rain moved north and east. The mercury showed a big dference between the north and the south, with mild air in the southeast and colder temperatures in Scotland.  Wales was rainy pretty much all day, with more showers recorded in the evening, where a yellow warning remained in place until midnight. The heaviest rainfall was registered in Croeserw, West Glamorgan, with .mm of rain, according to the Met Office. The village of Treherbert followed with mm of rain. Sunday will be much warmer, although some areas are still expected to be wet, the Met Office said.  Forecasters said: Sunday morning will be largely frost free and cloudy. Heavy showers will roll into the northwest and patchy light rain will move eastwards across England and Wales. Scotland and Northern Ireland will be wet, with heavy rain, while other areas will experience sunny spells today, according to the Met Officeaposs forecast. The weather will stay warm in southeastern England, with temperatures reaching C in the afternoon. Next week will see a mixture of sunshine and showers, with a risk of thunder at times. Starting from May , Brits will be able to visit indoor hospitality venues as coronavirus lockdown restrictions are eased.
